Title: Working Student – Data and Business Intelligence Support
Description:
About Us

Born as a Berlin startup in 2002, think-cell has evolved into a global leader in presentation software, revolutionizing how business professionals create and deliver impactful presentations. Our PowerPoint and Excel add-ins have become the gold standard for data visualization and presentation design, trusted by leading management consulting firms, investment banks, and Fortune 500 companies worldwide.

From our pioneering automated chart creation to intelligent layout solutions, we've consistently pushed the boundaries of what's possible in presentation software. With over two decades of innovation and a commitment to excellence, we've established ourselves as an indispensable tool in the corporate world, helping professionals transform complex data into compelling visual stories.

Now, backed by Cinven, a leading global private equity firm, we're entering an exciting new chapter of strategic growth and product innovation. As we continue to expand our suite of solutions and reach new markets, we remain dedicated to our founding principle: making sophisticated visualization accessible through intelligent automation.

We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Working Student to join our Data team and support us in business intelligence (BI) and analytical work. This is a great opportunity for someone interested in working with data, learning about data architecture, and gaining hands-on experience with powerful tools like Power BI. The role offers the potential for growth, with an opportunity to become a permanent employee after completion.

What You Will Do


Assist with the implementation and maintenance of Power BI tools for data visualization, reporting, and analysis.
Work with data access, governance, and management processes within Power BI.
Learn fundamental data architecture principles, including how data tables and sources are structured.
Assist with creating data models and reports and support analytical tasks to ensure effective use of data across the organization.
Work alongside the Head of Data and support data-related projects.
Collaborate with team members to analyze data and assist in developing actionable insights.


You will be great for this position if you have


Currently studying in a relevant field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, or similar.
Comfortable learning new tools, with a particular focus on Power BI.
Basic knowledge or willingness to learn SQL and Python for data manipulation and analysis.
An interest in working with data and a passion for analytical tasks.
Previous work experience, ideally in a data-related field, is a plus but not required.
Reliable and motivated to contribute to the team.
Flexible, with the ability to work between 6 months to 2 years.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree students welcome.


Why think-cell is the right place for you?


Growth Potential: Opportunity to transition into a permanent role after the initial contract period.
Learning Environment: Gain hands-on experience with data tools, architecture, and processes in a professional setting.
Team Support: You will be working closely with the Head of Data, and other experienced professionals in the team.
Flexible Work: Initially, work onsite (junior level), with the potential for a more hybrid work model as experience grows.
Pioneering Role: Join us at the beginning of our data transformation journey, where you'll learn and grow alongside our new Data team as we build modern solutions together.


Join us as we shape the future of business communication and data visualization. The next chapter of our success story is being written now, and we're looking for exceptional talent to be part of it.

Our PowerPoint and Excel add-ins have become the gold standard for data visualization and presentation design, trusted by leading management consulting firms, investment banks, and Fortune 500 companies worldwide.

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
Are you a data detective who loves turning numbers into narratives and insights into action? Do you get a thrill from uncovering the "why" behind business trends and using that knowledge to shape strategy?




We are looking for a sharp and driven Product Analyst to empower our teams with data-driven intelligence working at our HQ in Dubai, UAE.. In this role, you will be the cornerstone of decision-making, providing the analytical firepower that guides our product roadmap and business strategy. You'll go beyond reporting—you'll be a strategic partner, using data to identify opportunities, mitigate risks, and tell the story of where we should go next.




If you have a consultant's problem-solving skills and a passion for the product lifecycle, this is your opportunity to make a tangible impact.




What You'll Do:

Analyze complex datasets, core metrics, and business drivers to generate actionable insights that answer our most pressing questions.
Develop and maintain intuitive dashboards, reports, and analytical frameworks that empower teams across the company to make smarter, faster decisions.
Partner directly with Product Managers and business leaders to identify growth opportunities, potential risks, and areas for optimization.
Provide research and analysis on market trends and leverage AI-driven analytical techniques to keep us at the forefront of innovation.




Who You Are (Qualifications):

You have experience in a highly analytical role (e.g., Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Strategy Analyst) within a consulting firm, tech company, or product-led organization.
You possess a strong quantitative background and are proficient in SQL, Python, R, or other data analysis tools. Experience with data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI) is essential.
You are a structured problem-solver who breaks down complex, ambiguous problems into actionable steps—consulting experience is a major plus.
You take ownership of your work from start to finish, demonstrating accountability for your insights and their impact.
You have an enterprise mindset: you're resilient, proactive, and have the drive to "find a way" to get to the answer.




Ideal Backgrounds Include:

Former analysts from top-tier consulting firms with exposure to tech, data, or AI projects.
Analysts from product-first organizations (e.g., tech-enabled consumer companies, SaaS businesses) who are skilled at partnering with product teams.




Why Join Us?

Strategic Influence: Your analysis will directly inform key product and business decisions, giving you a front-row seat to our strategy.
Skill Growth: Hone your technical skills while developing deep business acumen and strategic thinking in a high-impact environment.
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values curiosity, intellectual rigor, and data-driven debate.




About Us-




Landmark Group




Our journey started in 1973 with a single store in Bahrain. Since then, we have grown into a global retail and hospitality group. The proud creator of 25 plus value led, own-built brands across retail, hospitality, food, and leisure.




Over the years, our UAE - based group has evolved into a comprehensive retail and hospitality entity, with over 2200 retail stores, leisure, and hospitality outlets, panning the GCC, Middle East, India, Southeast Asia, and Africa. Today, Landmark Group is one of GCC's largest omnichannel retailers and India's top home and fashion retailer.




We take immense pride in the organic growth of our retail brands, which have blossomed into household names. From Max, Splash, Babyshop, Centrepoint, Shoemart, Home Centre, Emax, Fitness First, to Fun City, to name a few, our brands span across a multitude of categories, enriching the lives of countless families over the past decade.




As a part of the Landmark Group, a renowned retail and hospitality conglomerate in the Middle East, North Africa, and India, Landmark Digital is the dynamic digital arm of Landmark Retail, serving as the cornerstone of our omnichannel business strategy.




Headquartered in Dubai, UAE, we oversee the digital operations of eight leading brands across diverse geographies, with ambitious plans for expansion into new territories and functions. Joining us means becoming a vital part of the Middle East's most significant bricks-to-clicks success story, boasting an impressive year-on-year growth rate exceeding 100%.




Comprising a talented workforce of over 700 professionals across diverse domains, Landmark Digital spearheads various functions including Enterprise and E-commerce Tech, Product Management, User Design, and MarTech, among others. With our futuristic outlook, we are committed to delivering seamless digital experiences to our customers.




Landmark Digital




At Landmark Digital, we cultivate an agile work culture, empowering you to make impactful decisions from day one within collaborative squads comprising professionals from over 20 nationalities. Additionally, our dedicated software development center in Bangalore, India, offers opportunities for incubation, design, and optimization of digital products.




Working at Landmark Digital means engaging with cutting-edge technologies, including Enterprise and E-commerce tech, headless commerce, Java Spring Boot, React Native, React frontend, and Azure Cloud solutions, providing an enriching environment for professional growth and development.




In addition to competitive remuneration and benefits, we prioritize continuous learning and growth through dedicated training and upskilling initiatives. Furthermore, our vibrant workplace culture fosters camaraderie through various team events, celebrations, and recreational amenities, ensuring a fulfilling experience both personally and professionally.




Come be a part of Landmark Digital, where innovation, collaboration, and growth converge to redefine the digital retail landscape

Show more
HTML:
Are you a data detective who loves turning numbers into narratives and insights into action? Do you get a thrill from uncovering the "why" behind business trends and using that knowledge to shape strategy?


We are looking for a sharp and driven Product Analyst to empower our teams with data-driven intelligence working at our HQ in Dubai, UAE.. In this role, you will be the cornerstone of decision-making, providing the analytical firepower that guides our product roadmap and business strategy. You'll go beyond reporting—you'll be a strategic partner, using data to identify opportunities, mitigate risks, and tell the story of where we should go next.


If you have a consultant's problem-solving skills and a passion for the product lifecycle, this is your opportunity to make a tangible impact.


What You'll Do:

  • Analyze complex datasets, core metrics, and business drivers to generate actionable insights that answer our most pressing questions.
  • Develop and maintain intuitive dashboards, reports, and analytical frameworks that empower teams across the company to make smarter, faster decisions.
  • Partner directly with Product Managers and business leaders to identify growth opportunities, potential risks, and areas for optimization.
  • Provide research and analysis on market trends and leverage AI-driven analytical techniques to keep us at the forefront of innovation.


Who You Are (Qualifications):

  • You have experience in a highly analytical role (e.g., Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Strategy Analyst) within a consulting firm, tech company, or product-led organization.
  • You possess a strong quantitative background and are proficient in SQL, Python, R, or other data analysis tools. Experience with data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI) is essential.
  • You are a structured problem-solver who breaks down complex, ambiguous problems into actionable steps—consulting experience is a major plus.
  • You take ownership of your work from start to finish, demonstrating accountability for your insights and their impact.
  • You have an enterprise mindset: you're resilient, proactive, and have the drive to "find a way" to get to the answer.


Ideal Backgrounds Include:

  • Former analysts from top-tier consulting firms with exposure to tech, data, or AI projects.
  • Analysts from product-first organizations (e.g., tech-enabled consumer companies, SaaS businesses) who are skilled at partnering with product teams.


Why Join Us?

  • Strategic Influence: Your analysis will directly inform key product and business decisions, giving you a front-row seat to our strategy.
  • Skill Growth: Hone your technical skills while developing deep business acumen and strategic thinking in a high-impact environment.
  • Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values curiosity, intellectual rigor, and data-driven debate.


About Us-


Landmark Group


Our journey started in 1973 with a single store in Bahrain. Since then, we have grown into a global retail and hospitality group. The proud creator of 25 plus value led, own-built brands across retail, hospitality, food, and leisure.


Over the years, our UAE - based group has evolved into a comprehensive retail and hospitality entity, with over 2200 retail stores, leisure, and hospitality outlets, panning the GCC, Middle East, India, Southeast Asia, and Africa. Today, Landmark Group is one of GCC's largest omnichannel retailers and India's top home and fashion retailer.


We take immense pride in the organic growth of our retail brands, which have blossomed into household names. From Max, Splash, Babyshop, Centrepoint, Shoemart, Home Centre, Emax, Fitness First, to Fun City, to name a few, our brands span across a multitude of categories, enriching the lives of countless families over the past decade.


As a part of the Landmark Group, a renowned retail and hospitality conglomerate in the Middle East, North Africa, and India, Landmark Digital is the dynamic digital arm of Landmark Retail, serving as the cornerstone of our omnichannel business strategy.


Headquartered in Dubai, UAE, we oversee the digital operations of eight leading brands across diverse geographies, with ambitious plans for expansion into new territories and functions. Joining us means becoming a vital part of the Middle East's most significant bricks-to-clicks success story, boasting an impressive year-on-year growth rate exceeding 100%.


Comprising a talented workforce of over 700 professionals across diverse domains, Landmark Digital spearheads various functions including Enterprise and E-commerce Tech, Product Management, User Design, and MarTech, among others. With our futuristic outlook, we are committed to delivering seamless digital experiences to our customers.


Landmark Digital


At Landmark Digital, we cultivate an agile work culture, empowering you to make impactful decisions from day one within collaborative squads comprising professionals from over 20 nationalities. Additionally, our dedicated software development center in Bangalore, India, offers opportunities for incubation, design, and optimization of digital products.


Working at Landmark Digital means engaging with cutting-edge technologies, including Enterprise and E-commerce tech, headless commerce, Java Spring Boot, React Native, React frontend, and Azure Cloud solutions, providing an enriching environment for professional growth and development.


In addition to competitive remuneration and benefits, we prioritize continuous learning and growth through dedicated training and upskilling initiatives. Furthermore, our vibrant workplace culture fosters camaraderie through various team events, celebrations, and recreational amenities, ensuring a fulfilling experience both personally and professionally.


Come be a part of Landmark Digital, where innovation, collaboration, and growth converge to redefine the digital retail landscape

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Adtech
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products


Qualifications


Overall 6+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.


Nice to have:


Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Dashboard Owner (m/w/)
Description:
Die RIB-Gruppe ist der weltweit führende Anbieter von Softwarelösungen für die Steuerung von Projekt- und Unternehmensprozessen in der Bau- & Immobilienbranche. Mehr als 60 Jahre Branchenerfahrung befähigen uns, unser Ziel, die Bauindustrie zur nachhaltigsten und digitalisiertesten Branche des 21. Jahrhunderts voranzutreiben, mit unseren Kunden erfolgreich zu erreichen: „Building Better Together“.




Die Vision, Bauprojekte durch digitale Arbeitsmethoden effizienter und transparenter zu machen, haben wir in den letzten Jahren bei unseren Kunden Realität werden lassen - doch damit geben wir uns noch nicht zufrieden: wir wollen der Bauindustrie die Spitzenposition der Zukunft sichern!

Dies ermöglichen unsere 2.500 Mitarbeiter*innen weltweit; davon > 500 Mitarbeiter*innen in DACH. Als eigenständiges Unternehmen der Schneider Electric eröffnen wir dir dabei nationale und internationale Karrierechancen und sinnstiftende Aufgaben in kaufmännischen und technischen Bereichen. Sei ein Teil davon #ONERIB




Als Analytics-Team entwickeln wir leistungsstarke Dateninfrastrukturen, Dashboards und analytische Lösungen, die das Herzstück unseres Produktportfolios bilden. Unsere innovativen, produktübergreifenden Analytics-Lösungen unterstützen unsere Kunden dabei, schnell und effizient datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen. Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Softwarelösungen für die Baubranche!




Dein neuer Verantwortungsbereich




Verantwortung für die Konzeption, Umsetzung und kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung von KPI-basierten Dashboards für verschiedene Module unserer Bausoftware.
Übersetzung von Business-Anforderungen in nutzerzentrierte Metriken und Visualisierungen.
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit cross-funktionalen Teams (Produkt, Entwicklung, UX), um datengetriebene Lösungen produktnah zu gestalten.
Sicherstellung der Datenqualität und Konsistenz durch enge Abstimmung mit Data Engineers und Analysten.
Durchführung von Anforderungsanalysen, Stakeholder-Workshops und Feedbackschleifen zur Optimierung der Dashboards.
Nutzung moderner BI-Tools (z. B. Power BI, Looker, Tableau) zur prototypischen Visualisierung und Konzeption.
Beteiligung an der Definition und Umsetzung von Data Governance-Standards.




Dein Profil




Mehrjährige Erfahrung in BI-/Analytics-/Consulting-Rollen mit starkem Produktbezug.
Sehr gute SQL-Kenntnisse (inkl. komplexer Joins, CTEs, Window Functions, Performance-Tuning).
Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung (z. B. Star Schema, Snowflake, semantische Layer).
Kenntnisse in der Nutzung von BI-Tools zur Dashboard-Konzeption (Power BI, Looker, Tableau, Qlik).
Erfahrung mit agilen Methoden (Scrum-ähnlich) und Tools wie Jira, Azure DevOps.
Kommunikationsstärke, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und hohe Eigenverantwortung.
Gute Englischkenntnisse (Deutsch von Vorteil).




Nice-to-have




Erfahrung mit Azure Synapse, Microsoft Fabric oder vergleichbaren Plattformen.
Kenntnisse in Data Governance und Datenqualitätsmanagement.
Grundlagen in Statistik oder Machine Learning mit Python oder R.




Was Du bei uns erwarten kannst

Motiviert Durch Unsere Werte & Vision, Treiben Wir Die Digitale Transformation Bei Unseren Kunden Voran – Für Ein Digitales, Effizienteres Und Nachhaltigeres Ingenieur- Und Bauwesen. „Building Better Together“ Ist Für Uns Mehr Als Ein Slogan. Denn Neben Unseren Kunden Stehst Du Im Vordergrund. Damit Du Deine Leidenschaft Für Deine Aufgaben Voll Entfalten Kannst, Unterstützen Wir Dich Durch

einen strukturierten Start: individuelles Onboarding, organisiertes Networking
Goodies wie: Mitarbeitervergünstigungen (z.B. Corporate Benefits), Prämien (z.B. zur Hochzeit, Geburt, Jubiläum), Aktienbeteiligung Schneider Electric, Mitarbeiterevents (Teamevents, Sommerfeste, …), je nach Standort: Tischkicker/ Tischtennisplatte/ Hunde geduldet, Gesundheitsmanagement (z.B. Vergünstigungen im Sportstudio, Betriebsarzt, …),...
ein modernes Arbeitszeitmodell: Vertrauensarbeitszeit, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Möglichkeit hybrid zu arbeiten
Karriereentwicklung/ -perspektiven: Team- bzw. Rollenbasierte Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, individuelle Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, nationale und internationale Karriereperspektiven innerhalb der RIB-Gruppe oder Schneider Electric, …
deinen Raum für Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten: proaktives Teilen deiner Ideen/ Ansätze/ Prozessoptimierungen innerhalb des Teams, betriebliches Ideenmanagement, aktive Beteiligung an Meetings auf Team und Managementebene („RIB Town Halls“), …
Wege, wie du nachhaltig sein kannst (je nach Standort & Funktion): digitale Infrastruktur, Company-Bikes, Fahrtkostenzuschuss, eAuto als Firmenwagen




UNTERNEHMENSKULTUR UND WERTE

Motiviert durch unsere Werte kreieren wir eine corporate culture, in der wir ein klares Bild davon haben, wie wir miteinander interact, kommunizieren, arbeiten, führen/ coachen, supporten und unseren Nachwuchs fördern. Dabei steht immer der Mensch im Vordergrund!




CHANCENGLEICHHEIT UND DIVERSITY

RIB fördert die Chancengleichheit von Frauen und Männern in allen Funktionen und Tätigkeitsfeldern.

Ganz gleich ob weibliche Führungskräfte, Mitarbeitende mit Behinderung, Berufseinsteigenden oder ältere Berufserfahrene – für uns zählt Engagement und die richtige Qualifikation. Der RIB Code of Conduct beschreibt dabei unsere wichtigsten Prinzipien in puncto Nationalität, ethnischer Herkunft, Religion,…




RIB VISION

Gebäude und Bauten sind für 36% des weltweiten Energieverbrauchs und fast 40% der energiebedingten CO2-Emissionen verantwortlich. Um die Branche effizienter, robuster und nachhaltiger zu machen, entwickeln wir Softwarelösungen, mit denen man im gesamten Lebenszyklus eines Bauwerks Ressourcen, Rohstoffe und Energie einsparen kann. Digitalisierung sehen wir als einen Treiber für eine nachhaltige Bauindustrie. "Building Better Together" steht dabei für das Zusammenspiel der beiden weltweit führenden Prozess- und Energietechnologien: RIB-Gruppe und Schneider Electric.

Unser Manifest beschreibt unsere Überzeugungen und Werte, die uns bei unserer Arbeit antreiben und uns gemeinsam zu Höchstleistungen inspirieren: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lfqlC37lhzk

https://www.rib-software.com/group/impressum

Show more

Gebäude und Bauten sind für 36% des weltweiten Energieverbrauchs und fast 40% der energiebedingten CO2-Emissionen verantwortlich. Um die Branche effizienter, robuster und nachhaltiger zu machen, entwickeln wir Softwarelösungen, mit denen man im gesamten Lebenszyklus eines Bauwerks Ressourcen, Rohstoffe und Energie einsparen kann. Digitalisierung sehen wir als einen Treiber für eine nachhaltige Bauindustrie. "Building Better Together" steht dabei für das Zusammenspiel der beiden weltweit führenden Prozess- und Energietechnologien: RIB-Gruppe und Schneider Electric.

Unser Manifest beschreibt unsere Überzeugungen und Werte, die uns bei unserer Arbeit antreiben und uns gemeinsam zu Höchstleistungen inspirieren: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lfqlC37lhzk

https://www.rib-software.com/group/impressum

Title: Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst to join our Consumer product tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you’ll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you’ll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by leveraging data to provide actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Singapore and Berlin, working closely with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise. This particular role is based in Berlin.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Experimentation: Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests with a strong emphasis on statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation and accurate impact measurement. A deep understanding of statistical techniques is required for all our experiment analyses.
Product OKRs & Metrics: Define what 'good' looks like by setting up a product metric framework and quarterly OKRs.
Tracking & QA: Own the tracking definition and work with various delivery hero brands to improve the reliability of user behaviour tracking for our discovery tools
ETL & Reporting: Building data pipelines and self-service dashboards.
Exploratory Analysis: Drawing insights from data to drive product strategy & roadmap.
Contribute to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge shares, workflow optimisations, hiring, onboarding of talent etc


Qualifications


5+ years experience in the analytics space in rapidly growing and dynamic environments, ideally with a broad mission scope or several stakeholders
Strong experience in leveraging SQL for analytics (BigQuery experience is a plus)
Proficient with at least one data visualization tool, including but not limited to looker studio (data studio), Tableau, Qlikview, power BI, matplotlib etc.
Experience working with large scale user data (transactional, click stream etc.)
Background in statistics, knowledge about statistical test design and analysis preferably hands on experience in designing and running A/B tests at scale
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
Experience of working with multiple stakeholders, ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to them and successfully driving mid scale analytics projects end to end (e.g. establishing a performance metric for a squad - exploring, aligning on metric definition, creating data pipelines and dashboard visualization to allow self serve).


Nice to have:


Experience with data pipelining tool such as airflow, DBT
Experience or knowledge of machine learning, recommender system, ranking algorithm.
Experience working in a rapidly growing and dynamic product development team


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Sales Steering and Analytics
Description:
This Challenge Awaits You

You will shape the future of data-driven sales at IAV and lay the foundation for data-based decisions with your work. With your expertise in data architecture, reporting, and AI-supported applications, you will create transparency across our sales pipeline and strengthen the organization's strategic control capabilities. You will play a key role in ensuring that our sales team can rely on reliable data – for greater efficiency, impact, and sustainability.

Your Tasks


You define standards for quality assurance in the sales pipeline and ensure reliable, high-quality sales data as a basis for strategic and operational decisions
You continuously develop CRM and dashboard solutions in collaboration with IT and drive the implementation of strategic measures to improve the IT and reporting landscape
You harmonize data processes and are responsible for their technical design.
You evaluate and integrate AI-based functions to increase efficiency in CRM systems.
You ensure high data quality through consistent data architecture


Necessary Skills


Degree in (business) information technology, data analysis, mathematics, or a related field
In-depth knowledge of data analysis and IT
Good technical knowledge of sales and reporting tools such as SAC and Microsoft Dynamics
Experience in translating technical requirements into technical solutions, particularly in the CRM and reporting environment
Competence in working with IT teams
Very good knowledge of German (at least C1 level) and good knowledge of English (at least B2 level)


Desired Skills


You think in terms of system logic and develop solutions with a high degree of automation.
You have experience with AI-supported sales applications and their data requirements.
You are confident in acting as the interface between IT and sales.
You work in a structured and independent manner and strive for technical excellence


Take on responsibility instead of being a cog in the wheel. At IAV, we’ll entrust ever more important tasks to you, step by step. Thanks to professional mentors, you won’t be alone and will be able to grow with your projects. You’ll work together with the big names in the mobility and research world. And you can acquire additional qualifications through e.g. in-house seminars or at conferences.

Diversity and equal opportunity are important to us. What matters to us is the individual, with his or her character and strengths.
Show more

Title: Junior Data KYC Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Berlin

Your Tasks


Participation in regular Know-Your-Business-Partner (KYBP) due diligence reviews and reporting to internal departments
Conducting screenings and background checks for new and existing business partners in accordance with internal guidelines and policies
Documenting and optimizing existing processes
Processing internal and external KYC requests
Reviewing client data to ensure compliance with current KYC and client due diligence requirements



Your Profile


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification in a related field such as Finance, Economics, or Business Studies
Completed apprenticeship in Business Administration, Finance, Law, office management or another relevant discipline
Basic knowledge in practices KYC, AML or similar fields
First Working knowledge of 3rd party DD
Methodical and well-organized approach to work
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Accurate and solution-oriented working style
Hands-on mentality combined with loyalty and reliability



Ihre Perspektive


Interesting, varied and broad range of tasks in one of the largest real estate companies in Germany and Europe
Individual onboarding program based videos, meetings and various tasks
Good atmosphere, communication culture "on a first-name basis" and a pleasant working atmosphere in an environment with flat hierarchies
Individual training for professional and personal development in our academy
Professionally equipped, in-house gym with trainers and classes
Comprehensive company health management and company pension scheme
Assistance on the commute through subsidy for the use of public transport
Modern IT equipment such as laptops and mobile phones
Opportunity to attend Bundesliga matches of FC Union Berlin, our favorite club
Discounts at selected hotels worldwide with up to 30% on overnight stays and special conditions on food and beverages
Employee discounts for special conditions in the areas of media, fashion, leisure, facilities and much more via a partner company
Drinks and a selection of fruits



Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?

Then click on ‘Apply now’ below and Marianna Margies will look forward to receiving your detailed application, stating your earliest possible starting date and salary expectations.

Aroundtown, Human Resources Department, Wittestraße 30, Haus F, 13509 Berlin

Title: Data Quality Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
E.DIS Netz GmbH | Befristet | Teil- oder Vollzeit

Als einer der größten regionalen Netzbetreiber in Deutschland gestalten wir bei E.DIS die Zukunft von Menschen, Regionen und der Energiewelt. Wir sorgen dafür, dass Millionen von Menschen in Brandenburg und Mecklenburg-Vorpommern rund um die Uhr zuverlässig mit Energie versorgt werden. Durch den zukunftsorientierten Aus- und Umbau unserer Energienetze gestalten wir die Energiewende maßgeblich mit. Und das ist eine echte Teamaufgabe! Wir glauben an die Innovationskraft unserer Mitarbeiter*innen, vertrauen auf ihre Fähigkeiten und schaffen Freiräume zur Mitgestaltung. Wir gehen neue Wege. Gemeinsam. #zukunftbeginntzusammen

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams der E.DIS Netz GmbH suchen wir am Standort Potsdam zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine/n Data Quality Analyst (m/w/d).


In dieser Funktion managest du Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung von Transparenz über unsere Datenqualität mithilfe von Power BI oder vergleichbarer Tools.
Du übernimmst die Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Prüfregeln (automatisiert via Skripte) zur Datenbereinigung.
Zur gemeinsamen Definition dieser Prüfregeln, arbeitest du eng mit den Fachbereichen zusammen.
In deinem Aufgabengebiet liegt auch die Koordination und Bereitstellung von Datenkorrekturlisten an die Fachbereiche zur Durchführung manueller Bereinigungsschritte.
Darüber hinaus entwickelst du unseren Datenmonitor weiter, damit Datenverantwortliche effizient damit arbeiten können.
Du stellst die klare, nutzerfreundliche Aufbereitung von Datenqualitätsinformationen sicher.
Du verfügst über einen Hoch-/Fachhochschulabschluss sowie umfassende Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen im Tätigkeitsgebiet.
Du bringst Kenntnisse in Skripterstellung (z.B. SQL, Python, DAX oder andere relevante Sprachen) mit.
Ebenso hast du bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Business Intelligence-Tools sowie Excel und großen Datenmengen sammeln können.
Durch Studium oder Berufserfahrung hast du ein gutes Verstädnis von Datenqualität, Datenbereinigung und Datenmanagement sammeln können.
In der Zusammenarbeit mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern im Unternehmen, zeigt sich deine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit.
Ebenso zeichnest du dich durch analytisches Denkvermögen und eine effiziente, strukturierte Arbeitsweise aus.
Du beherrscht die deutsche Sprache fließend in Wort und Schrift.
Eine nachweislich hohe Mitarbeiterzufriedenheit: Zertifizierter Top Arbeitgeber 2023, 2024 und 2025 (Kununu Score 4,3/5 Sterne & 97% Mitarbeiterweiterempfehlung).
Eine Aufgabe voller Spannung, bei der wir gemeinsam an intelligenten Energienetzen und innovativen Energielösungen arbeiten.
Einen flexiblen Anschluss für eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance, z. B. durch flexible Arbeitszeiten, Home Office und Sabbatical.
Ein elektrisierendes Angebot an Fortbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten wie z.B. Seminare, Workshops und Talentprogramme.
Eine sichere Versorgung mit einer attraktiven Vergütung sowie vielen Zusatzleistungen, u. a. Gesundheitsangebote und betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Ein starkes Netzwerk, denn als Teil des E.ON-Konzerns fördern wir die Zusammenarbeit über Unternehmensgrenzen hinweg und bieten vielfältige Perspektivwechsel. Werden Sie Teil unseres Netzwerks!


TITL1_DE

#PROMOTE-SECOND
Show more

Title: Analytics Consultant | DACH
Description:
At Biztory, we empower businesses to become truly data-driven. As one of Europe's leading data consultancies, we help our clients design, build, and scale modern data stacks that deliver actionable insights faster. Now, we're looking for an Analytics Engineer to help us shape the future of data self-service and modeling across the DACH region.

Your Mission

As an Analytics Consultant at Biztory, you'll guide clients through their data journey—from insight generation to impactful decision-making. You'll use your expertise in Tableau and the Salesforce ecosystem to craft dashboards that tell meaningful stories and help businesses take action. You'll work closely with stakeholders to translate business questions into clear, visual answers.

If you enjoy blending technical skills with business understanding, this role is for you.

What You'll Do


Design and build impactful dashboards using Tableau Software
Connect data sources, including Salesforce (Marketing Cloud and beyond), to uncover actionable insights
Work directly with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into tailored analytical solutions
Apply data modeling techniques to support effective self-service analytics
Lead workshops and enablement sessions to empower end users
Collaborate with cross-functional Biztory teams across Europe
Travel as needed to support client engagements within the DACH region


Requirements

What You Bring


3+ years of hands-on experience with Tableau in a professional setting
Solid understanding of the Salesforce ecosystem
Strong data modeling capabilities and experience working with business stakeholders
Excellent communication and storytelling skills - you're comfortable interfacing with both technical and business stakeholders
Fluent in German and English, additional languages are a plus
Based in DACH, preferably around Düsseldorf, Cologne, or Berlin, and ready to travel


Nice to Have


Prior consulting experience or other customer-facing roles
Experience with other BI tools
Interest in team leadership or mentoring


Benefits

Why Join Biztory?

We're not your typical consultancy. At Biztory, you'll:


Work with modern tools and industry-leading partners
Be part of an international, collaborative, and ambitious team
Have opportunities for career growth, including in AI and leadership tracks
Home set-up with laptop, screen, docking station, headset, keyboard, and mouse
Multiple team events and get-togethers per year
Company Pension Plan (if desired)
Company car, bike, or train subscription (if desired)
Reimbursement of phone and internet costs
Corporate Benefits Program


Ready to help businesses turn data into insight?

Let's chat.
Show more
HTML:

Now, we're looking for an Analytics Engineer to help us shape the future of data self-service and modeling across the DACH region.

Your Mission

As an Analytics Consultant at Biztory, you'll guide clients through their data journey—from insight generation to impactful decision-making. You'll use your expertise in Tableau and the Salesforce ecosystem to craft dashboards that tell meaningful stories and help businesses take action. You'll work closely with stakeholders to translate business questions into clear, visual answers.

If you enjoy blending technical skills with business understanding, this role is for you.

What You'll Do

  • Design and build impactful dashboards using Tableau Software
  • Connect data sources, including Salesforce (Marketing Cloud and beyond), to uncover actionable insights
  • Work directly with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into tailored analytical solutions
  • Apply data modeling techniques to support effective self-service analytics
  • Lead workshops and enablement sessions to empower end users
  • Collaborate with cross-functional Biztory teams across Europe
  • Travel as needed to support client engagements within the DACH region

Requirements

What You Bring

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with Tableau in a professional setting
  • Solid understanding of the Salesforce ecosystem
  • Strong data modeling capabilities and experience working with business stakeholders
  • Excellent communication and storytelling skills - you're comfortable interfacing with both technical and business stakeholders
  • Fluent in German and English, additional languages are a plus
  • Based in DACH, preferably around Düsseldorf, Cologne, or Berlin, and ready to travel

Nice to Have

  • Prior consulting experience or other customer-facing roles
  • Experience with other BI tools
  • Interest in team leadership or mentoring

Benefits

Why Join Biztory?

We're not your typical consultancy. At Biztory, you'll:

  • Work with modern tools and industry-leading partners
  • Be part of an international, collaborative, and ambitious team
  • Have opportunities for career growth, including in AI and leadership tracks
  • Home set-up with laptop, screen, docking station, headset, keyboard, and mouse
  • Multiple team events and get-togethers per year
  • Company Pension Plan (if desired)
  • Company car, bike, or train subscription (if desired)
  • Reimbursement of phone and internet costs
  • Corporate Benefits Program

Ready to help businesses turn data into insight?

Let's chat.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Company: For Life Produktions- und Vertriebsgesellschaft für Heil- und Hilfsmittel mbH
Description:
We are FORLIFE! We are passionate about developing, manufacturing, and distributing stoma, incontinence, and wound care products, as well as supportive products for enteral nutrition. Our ambitious goals have helped us become one of the leading suppliers of medical devices in Europe. At our modern production site in Berlin-Adlershof, over 150 employees work to identify and meet the needs of patients and healthcare professionals.




Your Tasks:

Direct to Consumer(DtC) project support: Contribute to the development and execution of our DtC initiative — including setup, insights on consumer behavior, and performance tracking
CRM data cleansing & consistency: Ensure high-quality customer and device data by identifying and resolving duplicates or gaps in our CRM system
Customer segmentation & analysis: Deliver targeted segmentation and behavioral insights to support commercial, marketing, and clinical strategy
Master data quality assurance: Maintain and improve product and customer master data across internal systems, hospitals, and patient portals
Dashboard & report creation: Build intuitive dashboards (Power BI, Excel) to support decision-making with relevant KPIs, trends, and user metrics
Process improvement: Collaborate with Sales, R&D, and Support to optimize CRM workflows and ensure data governance and compliance
Go-to data resource: Serve as the central contact point for business stakeholders who need analysis, reporting, and structured data support
Support strategic and clinical initiatives: Provide data and insights for product launches, service evaluations, compliance reporting, and patient-focused initiatives




Your Profile:

2–4 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally in healthcare, pharma, or another regulated industry
Proven ability to manage projects and drive deliverables independently across multiple functions
Strong stakeholder management skills — able to collaborate with commercial, clinical, technical, and leadership teams
Hands-on experience with CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce, SAP, Dynamics, or similar)
Strong skills in Power BI, Excel, SQL, and Python
Experience or interest in DtC analytics, customer behavior, or e-commerce tracking
Interest in AI tools such as Microsoft Fabric — Microsoft’s unified platform for analytics and BI
Strong analytical mindset and confident communicator
Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related field
Being Fluent in English is a must, German a plus




Our Benefits:

Meaningful work – Your work contributes to the reliable manufacture and use of vital medical devices.
Great team: A motivated and helpful environment that supports you.
Company pension plan with a 20% employer contribution for a secure future.
Special payments in accordance with the company agreement.
Individual training opportunities to promote your professional and personal development.
Business bike leasing for environmentally friendly and healthy mobility
Regular team events to promote strong and collegial cooperation
Mobility or sports subsidy: Choice of subsidy for BVG ticket or Urban Sports Club
Show more

Title: Staff Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Change the way the world travels

Be part of the GetYourGuide journey and connect people with unforgettable travel experiences worldwide. Since 2009, millions of travelers have booked unique activities with us in over 12,000 cities. Our headquarters in Berlin is supported by 16 other local offices across the globe.

Ready to join a diverse community of over 850 fellow explorers dedicated to revolutionizing the travel experience industry? Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department’s mission is to enable the Marketing organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics team whose objective is to help our marketing scale our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. This is a very strategic position within the team as the Analyst will look at solving cross-channel problems in order to accelerate our growth. This means for example addressing the best strategy to grow our mid-funnel spend and understanding the behaviour of our repeat audiences.

Your mission


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Propose and defend strategic recommendations to our top marketing leads
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Setup and analyse marketing experiments to drive strategic decision making
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Your toolkit


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing, especially data-driven platforms such as Google Ads and Meta.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


What Sets You Apart


A track record in solving marketing and growth challenges and influencing decisions/driving business results
Experience in understanding and modelling marketing journeys
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


We want your journey with us to be extraordinary


Here’s how you can expect us to commit to you and your growth.
Annual personal growth budget and mentorship programs for continuous learning and development
Work from anywhere in the world for 40 days per year
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Opportunities to collaborate and socialize with team members through quarterly team events and yearly company-wide events
Monthly transportation and fitness budget
Discounts for you, your friends, and family on GetYourGuide activities
Language reimbursement program
Health and wellness benefits


And more…

How to apply

Submit your CV/resume in English using the form below. For tips and insights into our hiring process and culture, check out ‘how we hire’ and ‘life at GetYourGuide’. If you have any further questions, please don’t hesitate to get in touch at jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Mit mehr als 375 Mio. Euro Umsatz und neun Apps ist die ParshipMeet Group eines der drei führenden internationalen Dating- und Video-Unternehmen. Unsere mehr als 500 Mitarbeitenden helfen Menschen auf der ganzen Welt dabei, neue Leute kennenzulernen – egal, ob es sich dabei um Gleichgesinnte, ein spannendes Date oder die Liebe fürs Leben handelt. Ganz nach dem Motto: Meet – Date – Fall in Love.

Wir suchen eine:n Data Engineer zur Betreuung, Optimierung und Erweiterung unserer bestehenden Dateninfrastruktur auf Basis der Google Cloud Platform (GCP). In dieser Rolle stellst du sicher, dass unsere datengetriebenen Prozesse, die für Business Intelligence, Analytics und Produktentwicklung essenziell sind, reibungslos und skalierbar funktionieren.


Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder in einer vergleichbaren Position im Umgang mit verteilten Datensystemen
Praktische Expertise mit Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Spanner, Cloud Storage, Cloud Composer/Airflow, IAM)
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Python (inkl. Testing, Packaging) und fortgeschrittene SQL-Optimierung
Gutes Verständnis von Datenschutzbestimmungen wie DSGVO und CCPA sowie sicherer Umgang mit sensiblen personenbezogenen Daten (PII)
Hohes Maß an Zuverlässigkeit, Problemlösungskompetenz und eigenverantwortlicher Arbeitsweise
Bereitschaft zur eigenständigen und asynchronen Zusammenarbeit mit einer Führungskraft an der US-Ostküste (regelmäßige Arbeitszeiten in den Abendstunden sind nicht erforderlich)
Ausgezeichnete Englischkenntnisse


Was du idealwerweise noch mitbringst


Erfahrung mit CI/CD für Datenpipelines (GitLab CI, Cloud Build, Terraform, Docker)
Erfahrung mit dbt oder ähnlichen Frameworks zur Datentransformation
Kenntnisse moderner Data Catalog-/Lineage-Tools (z. B. DataHub, Collibra, BigQuery Data Catalog)
Erfahrung mit Streaming Data-Ingestion (Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Kafka) oder Real-Time Feature Stores
Erfahrungen mit Tableau, MongoDB, PostgreSQL sowie kosteneffizienter Abfrageoptimierung
Wartung, Refactoring und Automatisierung kritischer ETL/ELT-Workflows in Cloud Composer und Python
Datenmodellierung und -optimierung in BigQuery und Cloud Spanner für analytische Zwecke und AI-ready Feature Stores
Implementierung von „Privacy by Design“-Maßnahmen: IAM nach dem Least-Privilege-Prinzip, Verschlüsselung, Audit-Logging und Maßnahmen zur Sicherstellung der Datenqualität zur Einhaltung der DSGVO
Monitoring & Support: Erstellung von Observability-Dashboards, Teilnahme an einer internationalen Rufbereitschaft und Durchführung konstruktiver Post-Mortem-Analysen
Asynchrone Zusammenarbeit: Dokumentation von Architekturentscheidungen und Runbooks in Confluence, Verwaltung der Aufgaben in Jira sowie Unterstützung von Kolleg:innen


Wir bei der ParshipMeet Group unterstützen Millionen von Menschen auf der ganzen Welt dabei, sich zu treffen, zu daten und zu verlieben. Unsere Teams sollen genau so vielfältig sein wie unsere Kunden. Neue Kolleg:innen bereichern uns mit neuen Sichtweisen. Dies ist für uns ein wesentlicher Erfolgsfaktor. Deshalb beurteilen wir niemanden nach Alter, Geschlecht, familiärem Hintergrund, Hautfarbe, religiöser Überzeugung oder sexueller Orientierung. Bei uns stehst du als Mensch mit deinen Fähigkeiten im Mittelpunkt!


Flexible Arbeitskultur
Arbeiten in Teilzeit
Zentrale und moderne Büros
Mobilitätsangebote
Training & Development
Essen und Getränke
Gesundheitsangebote
Altersvorsorge
Shopping Rabatte
CSR-Initiativen
Legendäre Partys
Team Building Events


Weitere Benefits und Einblicke in die ParshipMeet Group findest du über den Link im Kontaktfeld.

TITL1_DE

#PROMOTE-SECOND
Show more

Title: Staff Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Consumer Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you’ll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you’ll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the experience for millions of users across our worldwide portfolio of platforms (FoodPanda, Pedidos Ya, Woowa, Yemeksepeti, Foodora, Talabat, HungerStation, eFood, and Glovo), directly impacting customer satisfaction and driving growth. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.


Qualifications


9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
Experience working in Search & Recommendations systems.
Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

At Delivery Hero, you’ll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you’ll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the experience for millions of users across our worldwide portfolio of platforms (FoodPanda, Pedidos Ya, Woowa, Yemeksepeti, Foodora, Talabat, HungerStation, eFood, and Glovo), directly impacting customer satisfaction and driving growth. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:

  • Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
  • Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
  • Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
  • Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
  • Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
  • Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
  • Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.

Qualifications

  • 9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
  • Experience working in Search & Recommendations systems.
  • Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
  • Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
  • Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
  • Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
  • Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
  • Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
  • Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer) to join the Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In our Logistics Team, you’ll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-10 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalogue for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs


Qualifications


4+ years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for Internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject, (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL and Python skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Experience with data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus) and version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects; proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes. Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Nice to have: Experience with Airflow, experience with A/B testings and applied statistics and experience with using data lakes/data marts


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!
